title: Escaped ISIS fighters could become 'suicide bombers': U.S. official
text:
"Our expectation is that the vast majority of the individuals that escaped were Syrian and Iraqi and will be looking to stay in the region, they will be incorporated in the ISIS insurgency in all likelihood and we could well see them serve as suicide bombers and so forth," Travers said after he was asked about the escapees by Republican Representative Peter King.

Republican Rep. Mike Rogers earlier asked how effective ISIS will be in carrying out attacks following the death of Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi's, and Travers responded: "I don't think it will have much impact, if there were significant attacks in the planning, that planning will continue."
description:
"Our expectation is that the vast majority of the individuals that escaped were Syrian and Iraqi and will be looking to stay in the region, they will be incorporated in the ISIS insurgency in all likelihood and we could well see them serve as suicide bombers and so forth," Travers said after he was asked about the escapees by Republican Representative Peter King. 
              Republican Rep. Mike Rogers earlier asked how effective ISIS will be in carrying out attacks following the death of Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi's, and Travers responded: "I don't think it will have much impact, if there were significant attacks in the planning, that planning will continue."
